poem:
Title: "A Fly in Blair's Web"

Underneath Labour's paternal sky,
IPP, cryptic as a spy,
A two-decade misery dye.
Justice cloaked in Orwellian lie,
Life, measured by a wary eye,
Not long, not brief, just high and dry.
Guardians lament, the inmates sigh,
A so-called 'protection' for the public to buy,
Blair's legacy, in shadows shy,
In silence, we weep, in silence, comply.
